Title of Review: Cheap quality - not robust - dent easily - warp
Name: JT
Product Description: Size Name: 40 TILES (160 Square Feet)Colour Name: Grey
Review:
I purchased these for my garage floor (we don't park a car in it, just store stuff). Picture attached after laying the tiles and it looks good. However:

(read UPDATE below before buying)

Pro's:
- Easy to lay
- Comes with nice sticky fixers to hold it down firmly
- Easy to cut

Con's:
- The tiles do not join together anywhere as neatly as my previous tiles did (which I removed to fit these new ones). You can see gaps between the joins, some larger gaps than others
- The tiles are quite thin, in comparison to the tiles I removed they are about 60% of the thickness
- The biggest issue I can see is the durability of the tiles. The 2 attached pictures show the marks caused after 1 night of a very light set of aluminium ladders, and the other picture is from a bike wheel. These indentations have not come out. The picture in the listing shows a set of weights on the tiles, in real life that would leave a dent which would never come out. Again, to compare against the previous tiles I had, the old tiles never marked, these do instantly. Big problem if you are using them anywhere where items may be pressing against them.

In summary, they look 'ok', I will keep them for a year or 2 then replace them with some thicker tiles. Next time I will research more and look at the thickness. Obviously thicker tiles will cost more, but if I'm replacing them after a year I wish I had just spent more to start with.

UPDATE: After 6 months these tiles have warped (see photos). When they warp they never go flat again, and become a trip hazard. Very very poor quality. Avoid these and look elsewhere for tiles, unless you want to replace them after 6 months.

Review:
I’ve been enjoying using this and learning all the different ways you can use them; I definitely feel more motivated to work out when I’ve got the proper equipment! It came packed nicely in a mid-sized box and setup was very straightforward with easy to read instructions. Each of the parts were easily identifiable and the nuts and bolts were organised and labelled very well on a shrink-wrapped piece of card. It took around 35 minutes to build by myself taking my time to do it properly.

Once built, the bench feels very solid and doesn’t rattle or move around. Both the base and back are made from easy to clean PU leather and are surprisingly comfortable with plenty of cushioning. The foam rollers on the leg hold down are thick enough to put pressure on without feeling the bar inside. The back has 6 adjustments and the seat has 4, both are easy to move and firmly stay in place when set in position. The whole thing collapses into a more compact size that should fit under your bed; just fold the back down, pull the seat and frame pin out, unscrew the leg hold down and fold the unit together which takes less than a minute to do altogether.

Overall, I think everything about it is good quality and it was easy to build with a good set of instructions. There loads of exercises you can use it for, and it would make a useful addition to your home workout collection. I feel its competitively priced for what you get and I’m very happy to recommend this item!

However, the quality is noticeably different from the ones at the gym - it's not as good but still does the job as best it can.

As mine is on carpet, I have little worry about it slipping but there are rubber grips for added security - it can be set up on different types of surfaces such as carpet, vinyl, wooden floorboards etc.

It is adjustable which allows it to be used for a variety of work outs - making it easier to stay fit in your own home. From setting it up at an incline to having it completely flat, this weight bench is definitely suitable for this.

One thing I love about this is that it folds up - as these weight benches take up so much space (which I don't have much of), it is a huge relief that I can just fold this up and store it away. When it needs to be used, I can unfold it, use it for as long as required, then store it away again - allowing me to make the most of the limited space I have.

Perfect for those wanting to set up a home gym - shake the dust off those dumbbells and barbells and start getting that summer body!

Product: WINNOW Adjustable Weight Bench Foldable Home Exercise Gym Workout Bench Incline Decline Flat Bench Press for Full Body Workout
Name: techpuppy
Review:
If you’re a reasonably adept flat-pack assembler then putting this WINNOW Adjustable Weight Incline/Decline Bench together shouldn’t be too much of a challenge. There’s an illustrated step-by-step guide included and it’s reasonably straightforward and takes about 20 minutes. Once together you’ve got a sturdy and quite well finished incline bench that wouldn’t win any design prizes but is stable and functional. The padded seat and back panels are comfortable and have a decent vinyl covering. The back of the panels is less well finished with a non-woven fabric just stapled in place, but you don’t see that in use (or the photo’s) so maybe it’s not a big deal.

You can adjust the back through a wide range of preset angles, including dropping it to get a decline bench for ab’ work. It’s easy to change the angle by just moving the prop from one retainer to the next and there’s no lock or key needed. The seat and padded leg brace are also adjustable but more awkward to set and you have to either use a push-in rod or a screw-knob to lock them into place. The bench folds more flat when not in use so you can slide it under a bed or put it into a cupboard. You’ll need a decent amount of clearance around it when in use, probably about the same area as a king-size bed, but it’s not hard to slide it into a corner when you’re done.

Overall it’s a solidly-made decent piece of kit that’s flexible enough for a good range of exercises. It’s nothing special but seems pretty competitive compared to other incline benches and the decline option gives it an extra bit of functionality that some don’t have.

Product: H&S Ab Abdominal Exercise Roller With Extra Thick Knee Pad Mat - Body Fitness Strength Training Machine AB Wheel Gym Tool
Name: Siltone
Review:
There's now an innumerable amount of different ab rollers available in the marketplace, I guess because they've become a tried and tested way in which to effectively strengthen and build those abdominal muscles. So, I spent a very long time looking at the pros and cons of those being sold on Amazon, before eventually deciding that for my money, this one from H&S was the best available. Now that I've had it for a few days, I'm beginning to realise this one was a wise choice.

It arrived nicely packaged in a shallow cardboard box. Inside were two wheels, two handles (one with an inner metal tube). These components simply slide together on that chromed tube in a matter of seconds. A nice feature is that, for travel purposes, they can just as easily be disassembled to lay flat in a suitcase. You also get a decent rectangular floor mat, which is essential for protecting those knees.

By the way, there is no 'magic' exercise/machine to give you that sometimes elusive six-pack - using a variety of stomach exercises is key (and doing them in strict style) together with a 'clean' diet, and the ability to burn off those calories if you are prone to easily gain weight. The idea is to try and subtly build those abdominal muscles, but at the same time reduce the layer of fat covering them, so they become prominent - giving the washboard effect.

I train in a gym four times each week, and use a stomach crunch machine plus old-fashioned sit-ups at the end of each workout. I bought this wheel primarily to do extra abdominal exercises at home during my days off.

I've found this to be an excellent ab wheel and is, in my opinion, better than the ones they let us use at my local gym. I've tried it on differing flooring and have found it to have a surprisingly good grip on any surface - I've used it on carpet, vinyl, laminated flooring and ceramic tiles. It is VERY IMPORTANT to use this correctly though - that way you'll avoid potential injury and also achieve optimum results. The supplier sensibly directs buyers to the wikiHow website (ref: Use-an-Ab-Roller) which offers easy-to-understand instructions. There are also many good videos available on YouTube (where would we be without it?) - the two I can recommend are: Ab Wheel Extension by Bodylastics and Ab Wheel For Beginners by Minus The Gym. Use it the right way, and use it regularly and you may well find this is one of the best (and cheapest) investments you've ever made. If you have found this review of use please be sure to click on the 'Helpful' button below 🏋🏽💪😊

Name: Hobbs100
Review: After being out of the hardcore exercise game for 6 months i ordered this to start getting back into it and it does everything you could need, So the pro's: Locking the back rest in a half locked position and doing 30 minutes of sit ups leaves you feeling like you have been sucker punched in the gut for the first few days but it quickly goes and you can up the amount you do, The rowing system does work very well and you feel the burn on your arms as there are atleast 6 different ways to use them to completely work out the lower arms upper arms shoulders stomach cheat and back with these, The cons: with the rowing system is i would like to see a tension adjuster on it to up the difficulty as after a while it becomes to easy doing one thing. Same as the rowing i would like to have seen an adjustment ability on the back rest to give more tension for situps i prefer half locked so the second half of sitting up is all me but i have seen this on other similar products and that would be a big improvement,  it would also be easier to do straight situps it the seat had a lock on it as it tends to move to the left or right which can become irritating after a while. The only other con is the central lock on the frame is not the best making it quick wobbly could be improved. Overall a great machine for anyone from novice to experienced with this type of exercise i would advise anyone to try but with the adjustments noted above this would be a 5 star all rounder.

They're a good tool to add a form of resistance to your existing training protocol, thereby making your sessions in the gym more challenging.

If your goal is to increase the size of your forearms then these should be a requisite peace of weaponry to carry around in your gym bag. They easily fit over most dumbbell handles, as well as barbell and chin up bars, and can be used in a variety of ways and beyond, just be creative if you happen to run out of the more conventional ones. If you get tired of using these then taking a break won't hurt since they're not likely to expire before you decide to revisit.
